issues.title: Allow multipart submission of non modified FormData with Wicket.Ajax
WICKET-6498 deferred javascript
issues.body:
If addEventListener is used instead of jQuery  "domready" and "load" events, and OnLoadHeaderItem instead of JavaScriptHeaderItem, all JavaScript resources can be deferred.

Open questions:
- does this solution work reliably on all browsers?
- who decides which JavaScript resources to defer and which not?
- how to handle cases where user code is still using a JavaScriptHeaderItem?

issues.title: Replace filterPath pattern '/*' with empty string
issues.body:
A filterPath pattern of '/*' is now replaced with an empty string. This matches the behavior of methods getFilterPathFromAnnotation() and getFilterPathFromConfig().

I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the different beahvior when initializing Wicket in a Spring Boot application. When using a @WebFilter("/*") annotation or the init parameter filterMappingUrlPattern="/*" Wicket works as expected, but when doing the same programmatically with wicketFilter.setFilterPath("/*") the path gets internally rewritten to "*/" and Wicket than only handles HTTP requests to the root path.

issues.title: WICKET-6427 Fire an event once all ajax timers are registered
issues.body: Fire Wicket.Event.Topic.AJAX_TIMERS_BOUND event once all Wicket.Timer.set() calls are executed

issues.title: experimenting with suspension of requestCycle via servlet 3 async
issues.body:
Let's discuss how Wicket could support async processing.

Idea is to allow suspending the current RequestCycle,  example's LinkPage shows the usage.

Notes:
- async-supported has to be enabled on the filter in web.xml (I did so for ComponentReferenceApplication)
- pageAccessSynchronizer uses the requestCycle now instead of the thread 
, since two threads might process the same pages *successively* - is that a valid approach?(PageAccessSynchronizerTest has to be adapted)
- I changed ServletWebRequest to use its own contextPath instead of calling httpServletRequest#getContextPath(), since the latter returns null during async processing

issues.title: Error page redirection support for autocomplete ajax response
issues.body:
Autocomplete field resulting an exception with 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings#errorHandlingStrategyDuringAjaxRequests, 
set to 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings.AjaxErrorStrategy.REDIRECT_TO_ERROR_PAGE

does not redirect to the error page.

This fix will enable page redirection even for autocomplete field.

commit.message:
WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Revert the change to use 'request.getSession(false) because this breaks WicketTester/WebSocketTester infrastructure
WICKET-6509 Import junit packages as optional
WICKET-6484 Wicket.Cookie.set does not set 'secure' flag

WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Use HttpServletRequest.getSession(false) to make it more explicit that it is not possible to create a new HttpSession in WebSocket request.
If the session is existing it will be used, otherwise an exception will be thrown explaining the problem.
WICKET-6477 Component.getDefaultModelObject() wraps in RuntimeException instead of WicketRuntimeException
WICKET-6441 MockHttpSession and MockSessionStore don't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()
WICKET-6441 MockSessionStore doesn't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()
Update Node.js to 8.9.0 and npm to 5.6.0
WICKET-6489 Exception when "identifier|code" javascript is not start on PrependJavaScript
WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Check for storeTouchedPages == null before trying to use it.
It might be null in case an alternative serialization library is used

WICKET-6504 Use a serializable model for FileSystemResource's path

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/WICKET-6512-replaceSession'
[WICKET-6512] feedbackMessages, style, pageId, sequence and temporarySessionAttributes are not being dropped while session replacement
Update links to HTTPS in Quickstart application

WICKET-6506: Fix performance regression

Due to the way modcount == 0 was handled, the iterator was reinitialized
on every call to next. The fix is to no longer reset the modcount on
detach but increment it. This even fixed a corner case that was marked
in the tests.

Hello @martin-g,

I hope it's okay ask this question here, I'm quite new to the world of wicket.
I'm currently working on a little wicket project and using the WebSocketBehavior with your new `onPush()` callback to redraw my components works like a charm! So thanks for that :smile:

Hi,

Wicket Native WebSocket module is no more experimental since 6.14 - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-5488.
We may break the API only in 7.x branch if you (our users) suggest something that is not achievable without the break. 

Have fun!

saving before resetting the values of the cookie may not delete the values. In any case setting the values below after saving seems to serve no purpose.

toString() seems unnecessary here
Also note that using ; for splitting seems to violate cookie conventions and break loading of multiple values, as discussed in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-5648
Strings.replaceAll() returns CharSequence.

save() puts the cookie in the WebResponse.
the calls later just override whatever the CookieDefaults has set on the _same_ Cookie instance.
The cookie itself is written to the http response much later, when the WebResponse is flushed.

I think this should execute only if `FLAG_RE_ADDED` (a new flag) is false.
org.apache.wicket.MarkupContainer#internalInitialize is executed to decide whether a page is stateless or not at org.apache.wicket.Page#isPageStateless, so I think it may call several times `onReAdd()` unless we introduce this new flag. It should be set to false in `onRemove()`
split the `<li>`s on separate lines

reset `onReAddCalled` to false and call `page.internalInitialize()`
verify that `onReAddCalled` is still false. `onReAdd()` should not be called until the component is removed and added again to the tree

I usually remove such javadocs. They are inherited by default and add only noise in the code.

Extract `Application.get().getMapperContext().getNamespace()` in a protected method so it is easy for the application to override it. Useful for custom impls and for tests where usage of ThreadLocals can be avoided.
The code for finding the special parameters should be extracted to a util/helper class and reused where needed.

John

issues.title: [WICKET-6518] Log4j is replaced with slf4j-simple
WICKET-6517 ajax multipart
issues.body: With this change multipart Ajax requests *are* send via Ajax.

issues.title: Allow multipart submission of non modified FormData with Wicket.Ajax
WICKET-6498 deferred javascript
issues.body:
If addEventListener is used instead of jQuery  "domready" and "load" events, and OnLoadHeaderItem instead of JavaScriptHeaderItem, all JavaScript resources can be deferred.

Open questions:
- does this solution work reliably on all browsers?
- who decides which JavaScript resources to defer and which not?
- how to handle cases where user code is still using a JavaScriptHeaderItem?

issues.title: Replace filterPath pattern '/*' with empty string
issues.body:
A filterPath pattern of '/*' is now replaced with an empty string. This matches the behavior of methods getFilterPathFromAnnotation() and getFilterPathFromConfig().

I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the different beahvior when initializing Wicket in a Spring Boot application. When using a @WebFilter("/*") annotation or the init parameter filterMappingUrlPattern="/*" Wicket works as expected, but when doing the same programmatically with wicketFilter.setFilterPath("/*") the path gets internally rewritten to "*/" and Wicket than only handles HTTP requests to the root path.

issues.title: WICKET-6427 Fire an event once all ajax timers are registered
issues.body: Fire Wicket.Event.Topic.AJAX_TIMERS_BOUND event once all Wicket.Timer.set() calls are executed

issues.title: experimenting with suspension of requestCycle via servlet 3 async
issues.body:
Let's discuss how Wicket could support async processing.

Idea is to allow suspending the current RequestCycle,  example's LinkPage shows the usage.

Notes:
- async-supported has to be enabled on the filter in web.xml (I did so for ComponentReferenceApplication)
- pageAccessSynchronizer uses the requestCycle now instead of the thread 
, since two threads might process the same pages *successively* - is that a valid approach?(PageAccessSynchronizerTest has to be adapted)
- I changed ServletWebRequest to use its own contextPath instead of calling httpServletRequest#getContextPath(), since the latter returns null during async processing

issues.title: Error page redirection support for autocomplete ajax response
issues.body:
Autocomplete field resulting an exception with 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings#errorHandlingStrategyDuringAjaxRequests, 
set to 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings.AjaxErrorStrategy.REDIRECT_TO_ERROR_PAGE

does not redirect to the error page.

This fix will enable page redirection even for autocomplete field.

commit.message:
WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Revert the change to use 'request.getSession(false) because this breaks WicketTester/WebSocketTester infrastructure
WICKET-6509 Import junit packages as optional
WICKET-6484 Wicket.Cookie.set does not set 'secure' flag

WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Use HttpServletRequest.getSession(false) to make it more explicit that it is not possible to create a new HttpSession in WebSocket request.
If the session is existing it will be used, otherwise an exception will be thrown explaining the problem.
WICKET-6477 Component.getDefaultModelObject() wraps in RuntimeException instead of WicketRuntimeException
WICKET-6441 MockHttpSession and MockSessionStore don't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()
WICKET-6441 MockSessionStore doesn't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()
Update Node.js to 8.9.0 and npm to 5.6.0
WICKET-6489 Exception when "identifier|code" javascript is not start on PrependJavaScript
WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

WICKET-6513 NullPointerException at PageStoreManager$SessionEntry after login

Check for storeTouchedPages == null before trying to use it.
It might be null in case an alternative serialization library is used
WICKET-6509 Import junit packages as optional
WICKET-6504 Use a serializable model for FileSystemResource's path
WICKET-6514 FeedbackCollector(Component) should not collect session-scoped feedback messages
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/WICKET-6512-replaceSession'
[WICKET-6512] feedbackMessages, style, pageId, sequence and temporarySessionAttributes are not being dropped while session replacement
Update links to HTTPS in Quickstart application

WICKET-6506: Fix performance regression

Due to the way modcount == 0 was handled, the iterator was reinitialized
on every call to next. The fix is to no longer reset the modcount on
detach but increment it. This even fixed a corner case that was marked
in the tests.

easier rendering of components, closes #249

setup ThreadLocal independently from filter or tester
restored comments from former submit

onclick handler

issues.title: [WICKET-6518] Log4j is replaced with slf4j-simple
WICKET-6517 ajax multipart
issues.body: With this change multipart Ajax requests *are* send via Ajax.

issues.title: Allow multipart submission of non modified FormData with Wicket.Ajax
WICKET-6498 deferred javascript
issues.body:
If addEventListener is used instead of jQuery  "domready" and "load" events, and OnLoadHeaderItem instead of JavaScriptHeaderItem, all JavaScript resources can be deferred.

Open questions:
- does this solution work reliably on all browsers?
- who decides which JavaScript resources to defer and which not?
- how to handle cases where user code is still using a JavaScriptHeaderItem?

issues.title: Replace filterPath pattern '/*' with empty string
issues.body:
A filterPath pattern of '/*' is now replaced with an empty string. This matches the behavior of methods getFilterPathFromAnnotation() and getFilterPathFromConfig().

I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the different beahvior when initializing Wicket in a Spring Boot application. When using a @WebFilter("/*") annotation or the init parameter filterMappingUrlPattern="/*" Wicket works as expected, but when doing the same programmatically with wicketFilter.setFilterPath("/*") the path gets internally rewritten to "*/" and Wicket than only handles HTTP requests to the root path.

issues.title: WICKET-6427 Fire an event once all ajax timers are registered
issues.body: Fire Wicket.Event.Topic.AJAX_TIMERS_BOUND event once all Wicket.Timer.set() calls are executed

issues.title: experimenting with suspension of requestCycle via servlet 3 async
issues.body:
Let's discuss how Wicket could support async processing.

Idea is to allow suspending the current RequestCycle,  example's LinkPage shows the usage.

Notes:
- async-supported has to be enabled on the filter in web.xml (I did so for ComponentReferenceApplication)
- pageAccessSynchronizer uses the requestCycle now instead of the thread 
, since two threads might process the same pages *successively* - is that a valid approach?(PageAccessSynchronizerTest has to be adapted)
- I changed ServletWebRequest to use its own contextPath instead of calling httpServletRequest#getContextPath(), since the latter returns null during async processing

issues.title: Error page redirection support for autocomplete ajax response
issues.body:
Autocomplete field resulting an exception with 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings#errorHandlingStrategyDuringAjaxRequests, 
set to 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings.AjaxErrorStrategy.REDIRECT_TO_ERROR_PAGE

does not redirect to the error page.

This fix will enable page redirection even for autocomplete field.

commit.message:
WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Revert the change to use 'request.getSession(false) because this breaks WicketTester/WebSocketTester infrastructure
WICKET-6509 Import junit packages as optional
WICKET-6484 Wicket.Cookie.set does not set 'secure' flag

WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Use HttpServletRequest.getSession(false) to make it more explicit that it is not possible to create a new HttpSession in WebSocket request.
If the session is existing it will be used, otherwise an exception will be thrown explaining the problem.
WICKET-6477 Component.getDefaultModelObject() wraps in RuntimeException instead of WicketRuntimeException
WICKET-6441 MockHttpSession and MockSessionStore don't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()
WICKET-6441 MockSessionStore doesn't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()
Update Node.js to 8.9.0 and npm to 5.6.0
WICKET-6489 Exception when "identifier|code" javascript is not start on PrependJavaScript
WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

WICKET-6513 NullPointerException at PageStoreManager$SessionEntry after login

Check for storeTouchedPages == null before trying to use it.
It might be null in case an alternative serialization library is used
WICKET-6509 Import junit packages as optional
WICKET-6504 Use a serializable model for FileSystemResource's path
WICKET-6514 FeedbackCollector(Component) should not collect session-scoped feedback messages
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/WICKET-6512-replaceSession'
[WICKET-6512] feedbackMessages, style, pageId, sequence and temporarySessionAttributes are not being dropped while session replacement
Update links to HTTPS in Quickstart application

WICKET-6506: Fix performance regression

Due to the way modcount == 0 was handled, the iterator was reinitialized
on every call to next. The fix is to no longer reset the modcount on
detach but increment it. This even fixed a corner case that was marked
in the tests.

easier rendering of components, closes #249

setup ThreadLocal independently from filter or tester
restored comments from former submit

WICKET-6498 deferred javascript
pull_requests.body:
If addEventListener is used instead of jQuery  "domready" and "load" events, and OnLoadHeaderItem instead of JavaScriptHeaderItem, all JavaScript resources can be deferred.

Open questions:
- does this solution work reliably on all browsers?
- who decides which JavaScript resources to defer and which not?
- how to handle cases where user code is still using a JavaScriptHeaderItem?

pull_requests.title: Replace filterPath pattern '/*' with empty string
pull_requests.body:
A filterPath pattern of '/*' is now replaced with an empty string. This matches the behavior of methods getFilterPathFromAnnotation() and getFilterPathFromConfig().

I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the different beahvior when initializing Wicket in a Spring Boot application. When using a @WebFilter("/*") annotation or the init parameter filterMappingUrlPattern="/*" Wicket works as expected, but when doing the same programmatically with wicketFilter.setFilterPath("/*") the path gets internally rewritten to "*/" and Wicket than only handles HTTP requests to the root path.

pull_requests.title: WICKET-6427 Fire an event once all ajax timers are registered
pull_requests.body: Fire Wicket.Event.Topic.AJAX_TIMERS_BOUND event once all Wicket.Timer.set() calls are executed

pull_requests.title: experimenting with suspension of requestCycle via servlet 3 async
pull_requests.body:
Let's discuss how Wicket could support async processing.

Idea is to allow suspending the current RequestCycle,  example's LinkPage shows the usage.

Notes:
- async-supported has to be enabled on the filter in web.xml (I did so for ComponentReferenceApplication)
- pageAccessSynchronizer uses the requestCycle now instead of the thread 
, since two threads might process the same pages *successively* - is that a valid approach?(PageAccessSynchronizerTest has to be adapted)
- I changed ServletWebRequest to use its own contextPath instead of calling httpServletRequest#getContextPath(), since the latter returns null during async processing

pull_requests.title: Error page redirection support for autocomplete ajax response
pull_requests.body:
Autocomplete field resulting an exception with 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings#errorHandlingStrategyDuringAjaxRequests, 
set to 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings.AjaxErrorStrategy.REDIRECT_TO_ERROR_PAGE

does not redirect to the error page.

This fix will enable page redirection even for autocomplete field.

issues.title: [WICKET-6518] Log4j is replaced with slf4j-simple
WICKET-6517 ajax multipart
issues.body: With this change multipart Ajax requests *are* send via Ajax.

issues.title: Allow multipart submission of non modified FormData with Wicket.Ajax
WICKET-6498 deferred javascript
issues.body:
If addEventListener is used instead of jQuery  "domready" and "load" events, and OnLoadHeaderItem instead of JavaScriptHeaderItem, all JavaScript resources can be deferred.

Open questions:
- does this solution work reliably on all browsers?
- who decides which JavaScript resources to defer and which not?
- how to handle cases where user code is still using a JavaScriptHeaderItem?

issues.title: Replace filterPath pattern '/*' with empty string
issues.body:
A filterPath pattern of '/*' is now replaced with an empty string. This matches the behavior of methods getFilterPathFromAnnotation() and getFilterPathFromConfig().

I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the different beahvior when initializing Wicket in a Spring Boot application. When using a @WebFilter("/*") annotation or the init parameter filterMappingUrlPattern="/*" Wicket works as expected, but when doing the same programmatically with wicketFilter.setFilterPath("/*") the path gets internally rewritten to "*/" and Wicket than only handles HTTP requests to the root path.

issues.title: WICKET-6427 Fire an event once all ajax timers are registered
issues.body: Fire Wicket.Event.Topic.AJAX_TIMERS_BOUND event once all Wicket.Timer.set() calls are executed

issues.title: experimenting with suspension of requestCycle via servlet 3 async
issues.body:
Let's discuss how Wicket could support async processing.

Idea is to allow suspending the current RequestCycle,  example's LinkPage shows the usage.

Notes:
- async-supported has to be enabled on the filter in web.xml (I did so for ComponentReferenceApplication)
- pageAccessSynchronizer uses the requestCycle now instead of the thread 
, since two threads might process the same pages *successively* - is that a valid approach?(PageAccessSynchronizerTest has to be adapted)
- I changed ServletWebRequest to use its own contextPath instead of calling httpServletRequest#getContextPath(), since the latter returns null during async processing

issues.title: Error page redirection support for autocomplete ajax response
issues.body:
Autocomplete field resulting an exception with 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings#errorHandlingStrategyDuringAjaxRequests, 
set to 
org.apache.wicket.settings.ExceptionSettings.AjaxErrorStrategy.REDIRECT_TO_ERROR_PAGE

does not redirect to the error page.

This fix will enable page redirection even for autocomplete field.

commit.message:
WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Revert the change to use 'request.getSession(false) because this breaks WicketTester/WebSocketTester infrastructure
WICKET-6509 Import junit packages as optional
WICKET-6484 Wicket.Cookie.set does not set 'secure' flag

WICKET-6483 JavaxUpgradeHttpRequest can cause NullPointerException

WICKET-6493 WebSocket SessionIds are wrong (HttpSession one used instead of Websocket one) + NPE if no HttpSession is found during Handshake Request

Use HttpServletRequest.getSession(false) to make it more explicit that it is not possible to create a new HttpSession in WebSocket request.
If the session is existing it will be used, otherwise an exception will be thrown explaining the problem.
WICKET-6477 Component.getDefaultModelObject() wraps in RuntimeException instead of WicketRuntimeException
WICKET-6441 MockHttpSession and MockSessionStore don't call onInvalidate() on invalidate()

WICKET-6513 NullPointerException at PageStoreManager$SessionEntry after login

It might be null in case an alternative serialization library is used

WICKET-6504 Use a serializable model for FileSystemResource's path

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/WICKET-6512-replaceSession'

Update links to HTTPS in Quickstart application

WICKET-6506: Fix performance regression

Due to the way modcount == 0 was handled, the iterator was reinitialized
on every call to next. The fix is to no longer reset the modcount on
detach but increment it. This even fixed a corner case that was marked
in the tests.

Hello @martin-g,

I hope it's okay ask this question here, I'm quite new to the world of wicket.
I'm currently working on a little wicket project and using the WebSocketBehavior with your new `onPush()` callback to redraw my components works like a charm! So thanks for that :smile:

But I was wondering how safe it is to use this already. How long will it take until this is part of an official wicket release? And is it likely to become a subject of major changes?

Best regards
Karl

Hi,

Wicket Native WebSocket module is no more experimental since 6.14 - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/WICKET-5488.
We may break the API only in 7.x branch if you (our users) suggest something that is not achievable without the break. 

Have fun!

Wish there were another setting called stripWicketAttributes() that controls this instead, so we can strip the tags but keep attributes.

saving before resetting the values of the cookie may not delete the values. In any case setting the values below after saving seems to serve no purpose.

toString() seems unnecessary here

Strings.replaceAll() returns CharSequence.

save() puts the cookie in the WebResponse.
the calls later just override whatever the CookieDefaults has set on the _same_ Cookie instance.
The cookie itself is written to the http response much later, when the WebResponse is flushed.

I think this should execute only if `FLAG_RE_ADDED` (a new flag) is false.
org.apache.wicket.MarkupContainer#internalInitialize is executed to decide whether a page is stateless or not at org.apache.wicket.Page#isPageStateless, so I think it may call several times `onReAdd()` unless we introduce this new flag. It should be set to false in `onRemove()`
split the `<li>`s on separate lines

reset `onReAddCalled` to false and call `page.internalInitialize()`
verify that `onReAddCalled` is still false. `onReAdd()` should not be called until the component is removed and added again to the tree

`wicket` is too common. Maybe `wicket-crypto` ?!
I usually remove such javadocs. They are inherited by default and add only noise in the code.

Extract `Application.get().getMapperContext().getNamespace()` in a protected method so it is easy for the application to override it. Useful for custom impls and for tests where usage of ThreadLocals can be avoided.
The code for finding the special parameters should be extracted to a util/helper class and reused where needed.

What is the reason to ignore these packages ? Or why _just_ these packages ?
This seems to be out-of-date now with the new @Auto annotation.

These packages always generate weld warnings.  Currently none of these
packages contain classes that need to be injected so they are ignored.
Also the app developer can call
CdiConfiguration.get().add("ignore.me.package")  or
CdiConfiguration.get().remove(...).

In my next pull request 0.2-SNAPSHOT, I am refactoring the List Storage of
the ignorePackages to a Set and making the add,remove support varargs.
Going try to add some unit testing in that as well.

John
